poem:
### The Loughborough Walls

When rain tattoos the rooftop  
and London sky is a watery gray canvas,  
Dionne presses her palm against the wall,  
feels the secret rivers flow,  
mould a silent painter on her plaster.  
Promises of repair scatter  
like pigeons startled by city sounds—  
her voice, a lone echo  
in the hollowed halls of power.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mould, money and murder accusations – residents try to oust management on their London housing estate When it rains, Dionne* can feel water coming through her bedroom wall. “I touch it and I can literally feel the water soaking from outside to inside,” she said. Dionne has lived in a two-bedroom flat on the Loughborough Estate in south London since 2010 and has complained about mould to the organisation which manages the estate since 2018.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Mould, money and murder accusations – residents try to oust management on their London housing estate When it rains, Dionne* can feel water coming through her bedroom wall. “I touch it and I can literally feel the water soaking from outside to inside,” she said. Dionne has lived in a two-bedroom flat on the Loughborough Estate in south London since 2010 and has complained about mould to the organisation which manages the estate since 2018.
